sentences.en: " Well, Tom Sawyer he licked me once. "
sentences.cn: “ 哦, 汤姆-索亚揍过我一回. ”

sentences.en: Children licked their lips when they saw the sweets.
sentences.cn: 孩子们看到糖果时垂涎欲滴.
他舔了一下自己的手指。

sentences.en: He licked the dust and got fainted.
He licked the stamp and stuck it on the letter.
sentences.cn: 他舐了舐邮票,把它贴到信上.

sentences.en: Our team licked its lips because we had beaten the champions.
sentences.cn: 我们队很得意,因为我们打败了冠军队.

sentences.en: She folded up her letter, licking the envelope flap with relish.
sentences.cn: 她把信折起来，享受地舔着信封盖。

sentences.en: The apex of the flames licked the crimson sky.
sentences.cn: 火焰的舌尖舔卷着绯红色的天空。

sentences.en: The cat licked up all the milk which had overflowed onto the floor.
sentences.cn: 猫把流在地上的奶舔干净了.

sentences.en: The dog licked the plate very clean.
The dog licked up water in a puddle.
The flames licked against the building.
The flames of the fire licked the sides of the fireplace.
sentences.cn: 火焰卷烧着壁炉的边缘.

sentences.en: The size problem of the machine has been licked now.
sentences.cn: 机器的尺寸问题现在已经解决了.

trans.tran_en: When people or animals lick something, they move their tongue across its surface

trans.tran_cn: 舔( lick的过去式和过去分词 )，<口>打败，（波浪）轻拍，（火焰）吞卷
